intro: Rinorea passoura f. leiosperma, commonly known as the smooth-fruited rinorea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its small, simple leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
